boardgame.name: Stephenson_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Rocket
Stephensons Rocket
boardgame.description: Reiner Knizia expands his fleet of tile laying games with this game about colliding railroads in early 1800's England. There are seven different rail companies that players can expand. Each time you extend a rail, the other stockholders can veto your action, but it might cost them their shares. When two companies' rail touch, the railways merge to become one. The game is over when only one company remains or there are no rail tiles remaining, and the winner is the player who earned the most money over the course of the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: #43: Stephenson_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Rocket and Dealing with Frustration
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2000 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

Rio Grande version. This game is complete, unpunched and never played. Unfortunately the box suffered some damage during shipping. One corner has a dent which caused a split corner and a tiny bit of tearing along the edge. This corner has been neatly repaired with transparent tape. The opposite corner has a small dent on the upper side. Five counters have very small rippling on them from being crushed. Otherwise all other components including map are in excellent unpunched condition. Shipping will be at cost from central Canada. I accept Paypal, cash, international money order (pink not green if you are in the U.S.) and Canadian money order. Thanks for looking!!

Compete against your rivals by building railroads and trading shares in the classic (and OOP) game by Reiner Knizia. This is the English-language reprint from Rio Grande Games. This game is complete with all original materials in very good condition (some of the cash has minor wear, but it was very cheap and flimsy to start with), and also includes a printed Player_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Aid at no extra cost. A great addition to any true gamer_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s collection. This game has been adult-owned in a smoke-free, child-free, pet-free household. Played once. PLEASE CLICK ON MY USERNAME TO SEE MY OTHER SALES - I COMBINE SHIPPING AT 5.00 PER EXTRA GAME. You can also pick up in Chicago at no cost! I sell exclusively through BGG, so buying from me always goes back to the site.

999 Games – Stephensons Rocket Language: Dutch 2 to 4 players 12 year and older Duration: about 75 min New -- mint condition -- unopened -- still in shrink wrap. Weight: 1,320 kg Theme: Reiner Knizia expands his fleet of tile laying games with this game about colliding railroads in early 1800_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s England. There are seven different rail companies that players can expand. Each time you extend a rail, the other stockholders can veto your action, but it might cost them their shares. When two companies_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; rail touch, the railways merge to become one. The game is over when only one company remains or there are no rail tiles remaining, and the winner is the player who earned the most money over the course of the game. Comments: RGG edition. English. Condition Notes: Played once or twice and in good shape. Shipping Notes: You are welcome to come to Community Game Night (see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/127654) and pick up your game in person and pay $0.00 for shipping. Otherwise--Yes, I will gladly combine orders to reduce your per item shipping costs. (To see other items to add to your order see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekstore.php3?action=viewuser_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;username=RoamDog). Please provide a contact phone number--this is ONLY in case there are shipping issues--I am NOT planning to call you. Also, if you would like tracking information, also provide a direct/external (non-BGG) email address. Finally, if at all possible, please provide a business (rather than a residential) address and let me know that the address you are providing is a business address (this will expedite delivery). Payment Notes: Preferred method of payment for all transactions is for me to receive an Amazon gift certificate from you (see https://www.amazon.com/gp/gc/order-email?ie=UTF8_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ref_=gc_lp_4ways_email_white). US buyers: Preferred method of payment for all transactions is for me to receive an Amazon gift certificate from you. USPS money order is a good second choice. Western Union transfer is also acceptable. If you (the receiver) elects to not pay extra for insurance (totally up to the receiver) then the receiver agrees to assume responsibility for lost or damaged packages (I cannot remember ever having a problem, but the risk is there). Non-US buyers: Gift certificate from Amazon (see https://www.amazon.com/gp/gc/order-email?ie=UTF8_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ref_=gc_lp_4ways_email_white) and Western Union wire transfer (see www.westernunion.com) are the only acceptable form of payment. Must be in US dollars and you pay any fees. Non-US buyers--Please also note that the shipping charge will be outrageously high. Probably high enough that it does not make sense to purchase this item from me. I have no control over this. Insurance will also be REQUIRED (at receiver_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s expense) for shipments to non-US addresses. Receivers outside the US must also agree to assume ALL responsibility for taxes, tariffs, customs duties, etc. If these terms are not acceptable, please do not order from me. **Note that the offered price is the discounted price for a cash (cash, money order, Amazon Gift Card, western union) payment.
